p: In addition to specific cellular stresses, elevated ISR signaling components have been implicated in early pregnancy disorders characterized by placental abnormalities. For example, phosphorylated eIF2α, ATF4 protein, and/or CHOP protein were elevated in placental tissue obtained from pre-eclamptic pregnancies compared with normal pregnancies (Du et al. 2017; Fu et al. 2015). Another study reported mRNA expression suppression of an ATF4-mediated placental growth factor ( PlGF) in placentae from women diagnosed with early-onset pre-eclampsia and confirmed those results using two trophoblast cell lines (Mizuuchi et al. 2016). Furthermore, prolonged eIF2α phosphorylation decreased proliferation and invasion of trophoblast cell lines in vitro (Yung et al. 2008), a defining pathological characteristic of IUGR and pre-eclampsia (Brosens et al. 1972; Caniggia et al. 1999; Kadyrov et al. 2006; Meekins et al. 1994). Consequently, ISR activation in trophoblasts, as modeled here by HTR-8/SVneo cells, maybe a mechanism by which the TCE metabolite DCVC contributes to placental dysfunction.
